channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Enforce same version numbers of Perl all the modules in a distribution
What it means to be an open source leader
item.description: Jim Whitehurst is the CEO of RedHat, which isn't your typical open source organisation. Here is presents what he thinks makes an good open source leader, a key element of which he believes is seeing yourself as a catalyst and not a commander.

item.title: Automating Deployments: New Website, Community
item.description: Moritz is writing a book about deployment, and has created a place for discussing the topic as well.

item.title: Migrating blogs.perl.org: Third Progress Report
item.description: An update on the project to convert blogs.perl.org to a new blogging system from Evozon.

item.title: Maintaining Perl 5 - Grant Extension Request
item.description: Tony Cook has requested an extension of his grant for working on Perl 5.

item.title: All Software is Legacy
item.description: A great article from the current maintainer of the CGI module, where he takes us through history of CGI, and uses it to illustrate some points about the definition of legacy.

item.title: Perl - The Secret Workhorse
item.description: Jeff, who works for ActiveState, thinks Perl is a bit of a dark horse, used by lots of companies, and under-scored on various programming language charts. Plenty of people are just getting on and doing things with Perl.

item.title: Shadowcat Commercial Products
item.description: One of a series of posts by Mark, celebrating 10 years of Shadowcat. This one describes some key systems they've developed, some of them which are only used internally.

item.title: lickcreator â€“ my new project
item.description: Rohan has started working on project called lickcreator, a music notation tool for guitarists. He'll be writing about it on his blog.

item.title: A tar anomaly
item.description: Sinan noticed that a certain distribution fails to install on Cygwin, and tracked it down to this: if a tar file has foo and foo.exe, then when you extract from the tar file you'll get foo but not foo.exe. See here for example discussion.

item.title: The Taskwarrior's Kusarigama
item.description: Yenzie has started using Taskwarrior to manage his todo list, and already he's written a plugin system for managing Taskwarrior hooks.

item.title: Finding the most common n-grams in Russian using Perl 6 and HabrHabr
item.description: Rob builds n-gram frequency data for Russian, based on text from a Russian tech blog site, in Perl 6.

item.title: Digging into the performance/reliability work
item.description: An update on Jonathan's latest grant work on performance and reliability of Perl 6. The bulk of it was making object accessors a lot faster.

item.title: MacPorts openssl versus Perl
item.description: Tom found that a failure with LWP::Protocol::https was due to an upgrade from 1.0.2f to 1.0.2g of OpenSSL. He shows how you can downgrade a MacPort. You should be aware of the security issues announced this week (the most widely reported being the DROWN attack), which affected older versions of OpenSSL.

item.title: The flip-flop - chic for geeks
item.description: Andrew shows how to use the flip-flop operator in Perl, and links to further reading from other Perl bloggers.

item.title: Perl::Critic exclude some policies - fix others
item.description: Gabor walks through running Perl::Critic at a certain level, while excluding some policies that you might not agree with, or be ready to deal with yet.

item.title: Perl curio: Dereferencing blocks
item.description: Lukas points that that the dereferencing curlies in @{$foo} are introducing a code block, so you can do whatever you like in there, as long as it results in an appropriate reference.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: February 15th-29th
item.description: Two for the price of one! Two weeks worth of P5P in a single summary, so lots of bug fixes and lots of new bugs reported.

item.title: Fixing prereqs in dist.ini automatically
item.description: Perlancar's lint-prereqs script can be used to check whether your distribution has (the right versions of) all the right prereqs, and if you're using Dist::Zilla it can even fix up your dist.ini. I've never had any problems using [AutoPrereqs], but I know that not everyone does.

item.title: Alien::Base and Module::Build
item.description: If you've a module based on Alien::Base, then you should read this, including the comments.

item.title: On YAML and YAML::XS inconsistencies
item.description: Reini points out some problems with YAML modules for Perl 5. In a follow-up post he describes his thoughts so far on what to do about it.

item.title: Not so new shiny things: LWP::Protocol::PSGI
item.description: Kieren describes how testing web applications got much easier for him when he discovered LWP::Protocol::PSGI. Aristotle pointed out Plack::Middleware::MockProxyFrontend in the comments.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - February 2015
item.description: David's selection of new modules released to CPAN in February. I don't have a use for it, but I love the name of Regexp::Parsertron.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #241 - All Software is Legacy
item.description:
A good mixture of all sorts of topics this week, and my favourite of them is Lee Johnson's All Software is Legacy.

Oh, and if you appreciate Tony Cook's work on Perl 5, why not add a supportive comment to the post about his grant request.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
